entries.title: Elon Musk Is Still Silencing the Journalists He Banned From Twitter
entries.description:
To you, it looks like Musk unblocked journalists like me. It’s an illusion: The truth is that we are still locked out of our accounts.

The post Elon Musk Is Still Silencing the Journalists He Banned From Twitter appeared first on The Intercept.

entries.title: Twitter Aided the Pentagon in its Covert Online Propaganda Campaign
entries.description:
Internal documents show Twitter whitelisted CENTCOM accounts that were then used to run its online influence campaign abroad.

The post Twitter Aided the Pentagon in its Covert Online Propaganda Campaign appeared first on The Intercept.

entries.title: Pentagon Failed to Respond to Lawmakers on U.S. Role in Deadly Nigeria Airstrike
entries.description:
Members of Congress asked the DOD to answer questions within 90 days — a deadline that expired almost two weeks ago.

The post Pentagon Failed to Respond to Lawmakers on U.S. Role in Deadly Nigeria Airstrike appeared first on The Intercept.

entries.title: Henry Ford, Elon Musk, and the Dark Path to Extremism
entries.description:
Twitter’s billionaire owner seems set to follow Ford into the abyss.

The post Henry Ford, Elon Musk, and the Dark Path to Extremism appeared first on The Intercept.

entries.title: Sen. Chuck Grassley Has Been a Champion for Whistleblowers. Until Tom Cotton Caught His Ear.
entries.description:
Grassley, a staunch defender of press freedom and whistleblower rights, said he doesn’t think that the PRESS Act will be included in year-end legislation.

The post Sen. Chuck Grassley Has Been a Champion for Whistleblowers. Until Tom Cotton Caught His Ear. appeared first on The Intercept.
